meanings.sent1: Please do not fouler the clean floor with muddy shoes.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally fouled her dress with spaghetti sauce.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy decided to fouler the freshly washed towels.
meanings.sent4: The rain continued to fouler the once pristine garden.
meanings.sent5: The careless child managed to fouler every room in the house within minutes.

meanings.definition: A person who commits a foul in a sport.
meanings.sent1: The referee warned the fouler for his rough play on the field.
meanings.sent2: The basketball player was known as a notorious fouler during games.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy fouler tripped over his own feet while trying to steal the ball.
meanings.sent4: The soccer team's fouler received a yellow card for his aggressive tackle.
meanings.sent5: The coach benched the fouler to prevent further penalties in the match.

meanings.sent1: The smell from the garbage bin grew fouler as the days passed.
meanings.sent2: The pond water became fouler with each new pollutant dumped into it.
meanings.sent3: The spoiled milk was the fouler of the two cartons left in the fridge.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds grew darker and fouler as the evening approached.
meanings.sent5: The alleyway had a fouler stench than any other part of the city.
